citation.title: Validating the Communicative Participation Item Bank (CPIB) for use with people with aphasia: an analysis of differential item function (DIF)

facebook.title: Validating the Communicative Participation Item Bank (CPIB) for use with people with aphasia: an analysis of differential item function (DIF)
facebook.summary:
Aphasia clinical researchers from across the country collaborated to help validate a tool designed to measure how aphasia impacts life participation.  
http://www.tandfonline.com/eprint/G6hdqj32JUr8ZxJgIs3J/full

facebook.title: Validating the Communicative Participation Item Bank (CPIB) for use with people with aphasia: an analysis of differential item function (DIF)
facebook.summary: The BRAIN Lab congratulates Dr. Carolyn Baylor for her excellent work validating the CBIP for people with aphasia! We are honored to have had the opportunity to contribute a small bit of data from rural Montana and collaborate with a remarkable team of aph

author.name: BRAIN Lab: Brain Research for Aphasia and Intensive Neurorehabilitation Lab

facebook.title: Validating the Communicative Participation Item Bank (CPIB) for use with people with aphasia: an analysis of differential item function (DIF)
facebook.summary:
The BRAIN Lab is thrilled to have had the opportunity to contribute data to this wonderful project led by Carolyn Baylor! What a wonderful opportunity to share the experiences of people with aphasia in the rural Mountain West.

http://www.tandfonline.com/e
